sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: French President Emmanuel Macron announced on Sunday that France will end its military presence in Niger and pull its ambassador out of the country.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: This comes after the democratically elected president Mohamed Bazoum was opposed in a coup in July. Here to tell us more is international correspondent Annelise Bourges reporting from Paris. France is ending its military cooperation with Niger and withdrawing all its troops from the country. The announcement was made by French President Emmanuel Macron late on Sunday during an interview during which he also said that the French ambassador to the country would be returning home. He repeatedly said that France's sole objective in the region was to fight terrorism and that the authorities now in charge of Niger were, quote, friends of trouble.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Emmanuel Macron insisting that all French presence will indeed be removed from Niger as soon as possible.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Now, the question is, of course, how they will do that.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Authorities in Niger had announced on Saturday that they would be closing the country's airspace to all French aircraft and aircraft chartered by France. Anneliese Borges in Paris for Euronews.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: The announcement came after a chaotic day that began when a police patrol was ambushed near the village of Ban≈°ka, killing one officer and wounding another.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: The gunmen fled to a nearby monastery, where they barricaded themselves in and traded gunfire with Kosovo police for several hours.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: At least three assailants were shot dead in the confrontation.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Kosovo's Prime Minister, Alban Kerti, later joined hundreds of people outside a Pristina police station at a vigil for the Kosovar Albanian killed earlier in the day. Kerti called the ambush an act of terrorism and pinned the blame on the Serbian government.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Meanwhile Serbia's President Aleksandar Vucic has condemned the killing of the police officer, but remains firm in putting the blame on Kerti for persecuting Kosovo's ethnic Serbs. A man has been arrested in connection with the killing of the police officer.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Since March, Scotland's waters have been gripped by an unprecedented Category 4 marine heatwave, an unusual event which has caused mass marine mortalities.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: For some of Scotland's salmon farms, the staggering 4 degree temperature increase has led to a heightened risk of sea lice infestations.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: A recent investigation uncovered alarming evidence on five farms where fish were observed covered in the invasive sea lice.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Marine heat waves are becoming more frequent, which creates this optimal breeding reservoir for sea lice to rampantly reproduce and these are the things that eat the skin, the mucus, the blood of the salmon and you know these can expel out into the wider environment in their millions. Sea lice typically found in low densities in the wild have become a growing concern. An exacerbating factor is the increasing sea temperature. 2022 was a record-breaking year with salmon deaths doubling.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: This year the outlook is even grimmer.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: An alarming 8.9 million fish have been reported as dead on Scottish salmon farms in 2023 already.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: And while salmon farming was once seen as a potential solution to helping wild stocks replenish, sea lice are now making it a problem as they're spreading from the farms to wild salmon. Salmon farming was seen as a sort of salvation and then of course the complexities become more apparent and right now the numbers and size of wild salmon continue to drop. It's tragic. The salmon industry says it prioritizes the well-being of the fish and stresses the technologies and innovations it uses against the sea lice. But there are other threats that come from rising sea temperatures.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Jellyfish thrive in warmer waters and they can both sting the salmon and block their gills.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Across Europe and the world, rising sea temperatures in 2023 tested marine ecosystems and aquaculture.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: Any sudden big rise that gets beyond what the animals are used to can cause stress to the point where they will die.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: We could see mass mortality of aquaculture, whether they be fish or shellfish.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Salmon is one of the UK's top exports but this year around a quarter of farm salmon perished and whilst innovative solutions are being explored the global challenge of increasing sea temperatures will continue to affect both those who farm and fish and the marine life they oversee.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: But that journey all hinged on a lengthy return mission into space, lifting off in 2016, reaching Bennu in 2018 and starting harvesting samples in 2020.
